etymology.value: From Ancient Greek ἀναβαπτισμός (anabaptismós), from ἀνά (aná, “again”) + βαπτισμός (baptismós, “baptism”).

usage_notes.explanation: This term is archaic and rarely used today. The more common term is 'Anabaptist'.

readability_explanation.text: The word 'Abaptistum' is a very rare, archaic term for Anabaptist. It is unlikely to be encountered in modern English except in historical texts.
readability_explanation.note: This word is highly specialized and not part of common vocabulary.
